channel.title: Exception in thread "main" (at NPCHandler)
channel.description:
Hello Moparscape! I don't usually ask for help here so I hope I'm not breaking any rules. I've checked the guidelines and if I've missed anything please let me know.
My buddies and I are in the process of working on our own private server to just have some casual fun on, and then I went to edit something (at approx. 3 in the morning) and I compiled it. I do not exactly remember what it was that I did, but if someone could please clarify what is wrong with the code that would be greatly appreciated. I've looked around in NPCHandler and went to the loadNPCDrops area it is talking about, but I still cannot figure it out. This is in the run-server screen. When I compile I get no errors, either. I think I should also add that I haven't worked with RSPS in almost three years.
[IMG]http://img834.imageshack.us/img834/9408/errorwi.png[/img]
Thank you in advance.

item.title: Exception in thread "main" (at NPCHandler)
item.dc:creator: @Daginith Daginith
item.description:
@Daginith wrote:

AtomicInt_:

According to the naming in the command prompt, he is using project insanity, which uses an odd drop system.

oh i compltely forgot about that. lol.

Read full topic

According to the naming in the command prompt, he is using project insanity, which uses an odd drop system.

item.title: Exception in thread "main" (at NPCHandler)
item.dc:creator: @Daginith Daginith
item.description:
@Daginith wrote:

[quote=“AtomicInt_, post:3, topic:431569”]You messed up when adding drops to your drop table.

It is in a specific manner that you need to add them into it.[/quote]

like what he said, use this as an example:

int[] example { "234234", "23456", "23457", "3462" }

it has to have quotes, then a comma and a space in each one.

Read full topic

item.description:

It is in a specific manner that you need to add them into it.

you messed up something in an array in line 116. look there.
